definition: classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
old variant of 曆|历[li4]/old variant of 歷|历[li4]
to go through thick and thin (idiom)

sentences.english: We need to experience major events like the Olympics.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要经历奥运这样的大事件。

sentences.english: AMERICA'S political priorities have undergone a breathtaking about-turn.
sentences.chinese: 美国政治上优先考虑的事情已然经历了一个大转变。

sentences.english: The testing of FL has witnessed two periods of development: that of code-based testing first and then that of structure-based testing.
sentences.chinese: 外语测试经历了以语码为纲和以结构为纲的两个时期。
我可以从自己的经历说起。

sentences.english: The replier said that he went to a Chrisitan high school when he was young.
sentences.chinese: 回应当中的一位网友说到自己求学时的经历。

sentences.english: Perhaps, but many entrepreneurs go through a grind-it-out phase.
sentences.chinese: 可能吧，但大部分创业者都会经历一个艰难期。

sentences.english: She has has experience as a reporter, but Greg and Thomas haven't.
sentences.chinese: 她有当记者的经历，而格来格和托马斯则没有。

sentences.english: He was suspected to be a loner with difficulty experienced during relationships.
sentences.chinese: 他怀疑是孤家寡人的困难所经历的人际关系。

sentences.english: The Dunnings have a wealth of stories from the time they spent with Jackson.
sentences.chinese: 邓宁斯有一段与杰克逊共同度过的宝贵的人生经历。

sentences.english: Many people traumatized by what they had experienced.
sentences.chinese: 多人因这次经历受到创伤。

sentences.english: He told a heart-wrenching story of his childhood in the impoverished countryside.
sentences.chinese: 他讲述了在贫困农村度过的悲惨童年的经历。

sentences.english: At the same time, the North is going through a murky, ill-understood succession crisis.
sentences.chinese: 同时，北方正在经历一个模糊而难以读懂的接班危机。

sentences.english: A small illustration of this is the experience of Richard Garriott.
sentences.chinese: 这副小小的插图描绘的正是理查德加雷特的亲身经历。

sentences.english: It was immediately put to a severe test.
sentences.chinese: 它甫一问世便经历严峻考验。

sentences.english: During Bush's tenure, the US economy experienced only 2% job growth.
sentences.chinese: 布什总统在任期间，美国经济经历了只有2%的增长。

sentences.english: It at least underwent threehydrothermal superpositions.
sentences.chinese: 至少经历有三次热液迭加。

definition: setback/reverse/check/defeat/frustration/disappointment/to frustrate/to discourage/to set sb back/to blunt/to subdue
bumpy (of a road)/rough (of life)/to be down on one's luck/to be full of frustrations and dashed hopes
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
to be defeated/to lose/to fail (e.g. experiments)/failure/defeat/CL:次[ci4]
